children.name: jQuery
children.summary: A framework that simplifies DOM traversing, event handling, animating and Ajax interactions for rapid web development. jQueryUI library includes UI components.

children.name: Dojo Toolkit
children.license: BSD license or the Academic Free License version 2.1
children.summary: A full stack framework and component set for building web-based and mobile applications that includes DOM manipulation, Ajax, animations, effects, and widgets.

children.name: ExtJS
children.license: GNU GPL license v3 and paid Commercial licenses available
children.summary: A full stack framework and extensive UI component set for building web-based rich internet applications.

children.name: Twitter Bootstrap
children.summary: A  toolkit for kickstarting HTML, CSS and JavaScript for websites and apps including base styles for typography, forms, buttons, tables, grids, navigation, alerts, and more.

children.name: YUI
children.summary: A lightweight and modular JavaScript and CSS framework for building interactive web applications.

children.name: MooTools
children.summary: A modular, object-oriented framework that re-creates pseudo-classical inheritance with Classes that allow for extensible and reusable behaviors.

children.name: Kendo
children.license: GPLv3 and paid Commercial licenses available
children.summary: A full stack framework for building JavaScript-based web and mobile applicatings including support for templates, themes and UI widgets.

children.name: Prototype
children.summary: A framework including a toolkit for class-driven development and an Ajax library.

children.name: SproutCore
children.summary: An MVC application framework for data-centric applications that includes data bindings.

children.name: Ember.js
children.summary: Framework that tries to eliminate boilerplate and provide a standard architecture. Includes bindings, computed properties and auto-updating templates. Formerly SproutCore 2.0.

children.name: Blossom
children.summary: Another SproutCore fork, it re-architects the view layer to be HTML/CSS-independent while providing a high-performance animation subsystem that leverages hardware acceleration.

children.name: Google Closure
children.summary: Developed by Google engineers, it includes features like a JavaScript optimizer, a library of UI widgets and controls, a templating engine and extensions to CSS.

children.name: Cappuccino
children.summary: Created with Objective-J, which is modelled after Objective-C but on JavaScript, it abstracts away HTML, CSS and the DOM and implements APIs from GNUstep and Cocoa.

children.name: Tower.js
children.summary: A full stack web framework for Node.js and the Browser built on top of Node's Connect and Express and modeled after Ruby on Rails.

children.name: DHTMLX
children.license: Standard Edition is GNU GPL v2, Commercial & Enterprise versions available.
children.summary: Includes collections of user interface components, allowing you to create robust web interfaces, manage client-server communications with Ajax, and implement server-side logic.

children.name: CoreChain
children.summary: CoreChain consists of a Core module which controls DOM and Event, a UI module for component architecture and a Graph module based on Canvas. (Documentation in Korean)

children.name: qooxdoo
children.license: GNU LGPL and the Eclipse Public License (EPL)
children.summary: A JavaScript framework for creating apps for a wide range of platforms (mobile, website, desktop, server) that are object-oriented and utilize a comprehensive tool chain.

children.name: Mojito
children.summary: A JavaScript framework from Yahoo built on top of YUI 3 for writing apps that run on both the client (browser) and server (Node.js).

children.name: Meteor
children.summary: A pure JavaScript framework for both client and server that includes live page updates, data synchronization, hot code pushes and more.

children.name: Qatrix
children.summary: Includes hardware accelerated animation, DOM element selectors, DOM manipulation, event handling, AJAX, cache system and a library of useful functions.

children.name: Knockout.js
children.summary: A lightweight framework for building JavaScript UI's with declarative bindings using the Model-View-View Model (MVVM) pattern.

children.name: Backbone.js
children.summary: An architectural framework provides things like models key-value binding and custom events, views with declarative event handling and a RESTful JSON interface.

children.name: AngularJS
children.summary: An MVC and dependency injection framework that includes support for declarative UI templates and two-way binding.

children.name: Spine
children.summary: A lightweight MVC framework built with, but not requiring, CoffeeScript that includes features like asynchronous server communication, a full model layer and ORM.

children.name: Agility.js
children.summary: An MVC library that works with a single object type that contains a full model-view-controller stack.

children.name: Sammy.js
children.summary: A very lightweight framework for applications made up primarily of routes and events that is designed to be modular, with adapters and plugins.

children.name: JavaScriptMVC
children.summary: Comprised of 4 sub projects including the DocumentJS documentation engine, FuncUnit testing framework, jQueryMX MVC extensions and StealJS code manager.

children.name: Batman.js
children.summary: A framework for building applications with CoffeeScript or JavaScript including a system of view bindings and observable properties

children.name: Soma.js
children.summary: MVC framework focused on loosely-coupled apps that implements the Observer and Command patterns via the native JavaScript event system. Includes a MooTools version.

children.name: CanJS
children.summary: A lightweight (8.5kb) architectural framework that includes binding, template loading/caching and more. Supports jQuery, Zepto, Dojo, YUI and Mootools out of the box.

children.name: River
children.summary: River is a modular Javascript framework, not a MVC framework, designed to facilitate code organizing and coordinating framework using the Facade/Mediator pattern.

children.name: PlastronJS
children.summary: An MVC framework for Closure Library and Closure Compiler.

children.name: AmplifyJS
children.summary: A set of components to simplify data handling and AJAX request management by providing a unified API for various data sources.

children.name: Underscore
children.summary: A library that provides functions and helpers for functional programming support including function binding, JavaScript templates and more.

children.name: Mustache.js
children.summary: An implementation of the Mustache logic-less template system in JavaScript.

children.name: Handlebars.js
children.summary: A library that works in conjunction with Mustache.js to let you build semantic templates.

children.name: RequireJS
children.summary: A JavaScript file and module loader optimized for the browser but works with server-side solutions like Node and Rhino.

children.name: Microjs
children.summary: A large collection of micro-frameworks each with a very limited and specific intent.

children.name: UKI
children.summary: A simple JavaScript user interface toolkit for desktop-like web applications that comes with a rich view-component library.

children.name: Pure
children.summary: A templating tool to generate HTML from JSON data that can work standalone or with dojo, DomAssistant, jQuery, Mootools, Prototype, Sizzle and Sly.

children.name: EaselJS
children.summary: A library to simplify working with the html5 canvas element including a full, hierarchical display list and a core interaction model.

children.name: Paper.js
children.summary: An open source vector graphics scripting framework that runs on top of the HTML5 Canvas.

children.name: Raphael
children.summary: A small JavaScript library to simplify working with vector graphics via SVG and VML.

children.name: IvanK Lib
children.summary: A JavaScript 2D graphics library inspired by Flash.

children.name: jQuery Mobile
children.summary: A HTML5-base UI system for all popular mobile device platforms, built on a jQuery and jQuery UI foundation.

children.name: Sencha Touch
children.license: GNU GPL license v3 and free Commercial licenses available
children.summary: A mobile web app development framework built with HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript and including components like audio and video, a localStorage proxy and styling layer.

children.name: Zepto
children.summary: Primarily focused on mobile, this is  a minimalist JavaScript framework with a jQuery-compatible syntax.

children.name: The M Project
children.summary: An MVC framework for mobile app development including features like offline support, local storage, positioning, a touch-optimized UI, i18n support and native packing via Espresso.

children.name: jQ.Mobi
children.summary: The jQuery framework rewritten from the ground up to be optimized for mobile browsers on iOS and Android.

children.name: Spine Mobile
children.summary: Built on top of Spine that, it strives for a native look-and-feel and includes features like specialized controllers and panel layout, hardware accelerated transitions and touch events.

children.name: gbone.js
children.summary: Inspired by Spine Mobile but written for Backbone and adding design patterns like observer and cleanup mixins based on Backbone.js on Rails ebook.

children.name: jQTouch
children.summary: A plugin for Zepto or jQuery designed for mobile web development on the iPhone, Android and iPod Touch.

children.name: Enyo
children.summary: An object-oriented JavaScript framework built for mobile first, though it supports desktop browsers, and powering WebOS.

children.name: ChocolateChip UI (ChUI)
children.summary: A framework for mobile web application on the WebKit platform that provides layouts and widgets with built-in functionality. Has been ported to jQuery and Zepto.

children.name: xui.js
children.summary: An extremely small DOM library for authoring html5 mobile web applications. Originally written for PhoneGap by members of the PhoneGap team.

children.name: Jo
children.summary: A framework for mobile HTML5 web or native apps that includes widgets, lists and scrolling goodness using JavaScript and CSS3. Works well with PhoneGap.

children.name: Dojo Mobile
children.license: BSD license or the Academic Free License version 2.1
children.summary: An HTML5 and JavaScript framework that focuses on a native look and feel on modern webkit-enabled mobile devices such as iPhone, iPod Touch, iPad, Android and RIM.

children.name: DHTMLX Touch
children.license: GNU GPL and free commercial Licenses
children.summary: A full framework and UI widgets for building HTML5-based mobile web apps.

children.name: Moobile
children.summary: A mobile application framework built on top of Mootools.

children.name: Node.js
children.summary: Platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for building network applications using an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model for data-intensive real-time applications.

children.name: Rhino
children.summary: An implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java typically for embedding into Java applications to provide scripting to end users.

children.name: Mocha
children.summary: A JavaScript test framework running on node and the browser for asynchronous testing.

children.name: QUnit
children.summary: QUnit is a JavaScript test suite used by the jQuery project to test its code and plugins but capable of testing any generic JavaScript code.

children.name: Shim
children.summary: A cross-browser and cross-device compatibility testing framework.

children.name: JSDev
children.summary: A filter that is useful for testing as it activates selected comments, making them executable.

children.name: PhantomJS
children.summary: Designed for headless website testing, Shim is a headless WebKit with JavaScript API including native support for DOM handling, CSS selector, JSON, Canvas, and SVG.

children.name: wru
children.summary: A general purpose test framework compatible with web environment, node.js, Rhino, and now PhantomJS.

children.name: SinonJS
children.summary: Standalone test spies, stubs and mocks for JavaScript with no dependencies and works with any unit testing framework.

children.name: Jasmine
children.summary: A behavior-driven development framework for testing JavaScript code that does not depend on any other JavaScript frameworks.

children.name: YUI Test
children.summary: Allows writing unit tests that can be run in web browsers or on the command line, as well as functional tests to be run in web browsers.

children.name: Cucumber.js
children.summary: A port of the Cucumber Behaviour-Driven Development tool to JavaScript that runs on both Node.js and modern web browsers.

children.name: Buster.js
children.summary: A JavaScript testing toolkit for browsers and Node that offers browser automation, static html page testing, testing in headless browsers and more.

children.name: CasperJS
children.summary: An open source navigation scripting & testing utility written in Javascript and based on PhantomJS.

children.name: JSCheck
children.summary: A specification-driven testing tool inspired by QuickCheck.

children.name: Impact
children.summary: Impact is a JavaScript Game Engine that allows you to develop stunning HTML5 Games for desktop and mobile browsers.

children.name: ThreeJS
children.summary: A lightweight 3D library designed for a very low level of complexity and providing canvas, svg and WebGL renderers.

children.name: CreateJS
children.summary: A whole suite of libraries, including EaselJs, TweenJS, SoundJS, PreloadJS and Zoe, designed for creating games and animations.

children.name: Crafty
children.summary: Crafty is a game library including features like entities and components, rendering to Canvas or DOM and event binding.

children.name: CoffeeScript
children.summary: Billed as an attempt to expose the good parts of JavaScript in a simple way.

children.name: Google Dart
children.summary: Intended to solve JavaScript's problems and offer better performance, including  the ability 'to be more easily tooled for large-scale projects' and better security features.

children.name: Brunch
children.dependencies: CoffeeScript, Backbone.js, Underscore.js, Stitch, Eco, Stylus & jQuery.
children.summary: Billed as 'a lightweight approach to building HTML5 applications with emphasis on elegance and simplicity.'

children.name: ClojureScript
children.summary: A compiler for Clojure that targets JavaScript and is designed to emit JavaScript code which is compatible with the advanced compilation mode of the Google Closure compiler.

children.name: Google Web Toolkit(GWT)
children.summary: The GWT SDK contains the Java API libraries, compiler, and development server that let you write client-side applications in Java and deploy them as JavaScript.

children.name: Jangaroo
children.summary: Cross compiles ActionScript 3 to JavaScript. Includes libraries for flash runtime emulation and interfacing with other frameworks, such as ExtJS.
